Package utilities

Class Recipe

java.lang.Object
utilities.Recipe
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Recipe>
public class Recipe extends Object implements Serializable, Comparable<Recipe>
Class used to store Recipe data for one recipe. This class stores the following data:
  • Recipe name
  • Number of minutes it takes to make
  • List of ingredients it takes to make
  • List of directions for making it

This class is Serializable so that it may be saved to and loaded from files.
Author:
Katherine Wilson, Kyle Clements
See Also:

    • getIngredientString

      public String getIngredientString()
      Returns this recipe's list of ingredients as one String. Each ingredient is separated by a newline character.
      Returns:
      a String of all ingredients needed.

    • addDirection

      public void addDirection(String direction)
      Adds a step to the directions of this recipe. This will be added to the end of the directions list. This function will capitalize the first letter and add a period to the end of the direction as needed.
      Parameters:
      direction - Instruction to add to this recipe.

      Returns:

    • titleCase

      private String titleCase(String str)
      Converts the given String to title case. This function will ignore quotation marks at the beginning of the String and capitalize the first letter it finds.
      Parameters:
      str - String to be converted to title case.
      Returns:
      the given String in title case.

    • fixContractions

      private String fixContractions(String str)
      Fixes contractions in strings imported from the database. Strings containing contractions are usually converted into two words. For example, "don't" becomes "don t". This function will fix X's and X't contractions in these strings.
      Parameters:
      str - String to repair.
      Returns:
      String with its contractions joined together again.
